    • Constructor Detail

      • HumanPlayer

        public HumanPlayer(java.lang.String name,
                   Color color,
                   Board board)
        Constructs a new HumanPlayer for a four Player match.
        Parameters:
        name - the name the Player should have
        color - the Color the Player will have
        board - the Board the Player plays on

      • HumanPlayer

        public HumanPlayer(java.lang.String name,
                   Color color1,
                   Color color2,
                   Board board,
                   int numberPlayers)
        Constructs a new HumanPlayer. If less than 4 Players have been specified, an extra set of Rings will be given with a different Color. The size of the extra set depends on the number of Players.
        Parameters:
        color1 - The Color of the first set of Rings
        color2 - The Color of the second set of Rings
        board - The Board the Player will play on
        numberPlayers: - The number of total Players who will be playing the game

    • Method Detail

      • determineMove

        public java.lang.String determineMove()
        Asks the user for input of a Ring and a Field. Also checks if that Ring can be placed in that Field.
        Specified by:
        determineMove in class Player
        Returns:
        the String containing the move arguments

      • firstMove

        public java.lang.String firstMove()
        Asks the user for input of the starting base. Also checks if that Field exists.
        Specified by:
        firstMove in class Player
        Returns:
        the String containing the move arguments for the starting base

      • getHint

        public java.lang.String getHint()
        Makes the computer determine the best move on this board.
        Returns:
        The best move as determined by our ComputerPlayer
